dialogues.text: That’s the biggest heroin trafficker * in Harlem. We’ve been tracking her all night. She just put forty pounds of smack in your trunk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised a/o March 28, 1989 102. 115

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Heroin?!

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Step out of the car, sir. RICHIE i But...

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Step out of the car, please. They begin to frisk them both.

dialogues.speaker: SUNSHINE
dialogues.text: (to Richie) I’m sorry, I’m sorry Richie.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Yep! Lady Heroin, we finally got your ass and your boy too. Well, y’all are both going away for a very very long time.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute. Wait a minute. I‘m not her boy! I just met her this week!

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, right. You have the right to remain silent....

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Wait a minute man. Do you guys work under Phil Cantone? QuIck You mean Sargeant Cantone? *

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (momentarily relieved) * Yeah. He‘s a friend of mine. *

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: We don’t give a shit. He ain’t * nothin’ in this precinct. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised a/o March 28, 1989 102A.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (scared) Yeah, but...

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: We're gonna take your ass in, now. Cantone or no Cantone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 Revised a/o March 28, 1989 103. *

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: QUICK goes behind the car, opens the trunk and Looks into duffel bag. It’s filled with neat stacks of hundred dolla bills. He takes the bag out and walks back up to the fron of the car to RAY. They start to handcuff RICHIE when the flashing lights and SIREN burst from another cop car stop them. RAY and QUICK exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: The new cop car swings around and stops directly in front RAY and QUICK and RICHIE. Two white detectives step out a approach them.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: (flashing his badge) Whaddya got, Officer?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (nervous) Big score with Lady Heroin and her boyfriend here.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: (looking at Richie) This guy?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (happy to see white cops) Listen. Please. Could I talk to you for a second, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: What is this, confession?

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Everything’s under control, Detective. I think we can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: (to Quick) Relax, boy. You’re a little out of your territory here, so just cool it. Sims takes a couple of steps to the side. Then he turns a waves Richie over to him.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: (to Richie) C’mere.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE AND SIMS
dialogues.text: Richie breaks Ray’s hold on him and moves over to Sims. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised a/o March 28, 1989 103A. 11s

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) You know Cantone, right?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: Of course. We work under Cantone.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (relieved) Then tell these jigs to get the fuck outta here. I’m makin’ a run : for Bugsy, for chrissakes.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Why didn’t you say so? ANGLE ON RAY AND QUICK AND DETECTIVE HOGAN. Sims walks back to the group ahead of Richie.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE SIMS
dialogues.text: (pointing to Hogan) Detective, we’re gonna take the girl in. Let this guy go about his business.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: (getting hot) Excuse me, Detective. First of all, this is our collar. And second of all, he’s an accessory. Now we’re gonna...

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) ...You’re gonna do nothing. We’ll take it from here. Thank you very much, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (apparently nervous) But she’s got a bag full of heroin in the back of his car. Why don’t you let us...

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: (very strong, to Ray) Take off, pal. Narcotics division will handle this. Go write parking tickets uptown where you belong.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COPS
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 Revised a/o March 28, 1989 103B. *

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With Ray and Quick ooking on helplessly, Hogan takes Suns and the duffel bag from Quick. Richie gets back in the ca They then put Sunshine and the duffel bag in the white co

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, thanks. You guys saved my ass on this one.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: Just get outta here, and stay outta trouble.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (bringing him closer) Listen, maybe you ought to give the jigs something to... He reaches into his pocket and takes out a hundred dollar

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: (taking the bill) Whaddya crazy? They should be happy they got a fuckin’ blue suit to wear. Don’t worry about it. Richie STARTS the CAR and drives off. ANGLE ON WHITE COPS’ POLICE CAR Hogan walks back to their car.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE HOGAN
dialogues.text: (to Ray and Quick) Sorry, boys. That’s the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: (pissed) Shit. The white cops drive off in their car.

dialogues.speaker: RAY AND QUICK
dialogues.text: Ray and Quick are standing there with nothing to show for whole set up.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Now what. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 115A
dialogues.text: Revised a/o June 16, 1989 103c.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) We fold our tent and leave like thieves in the night.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: (going to the car) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Vera backs up her car and puts it into first gear.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: You guys were beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: BENNIE
dialogues.text: (from inside the car) Shut up, Vera, and drive. And don’t hit nobody.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: I’m not blind like you mother fucker. I can see. ANGLE ON RAY AND QUICK’S CAR. Ray and Quick get into the car. They back it around and h for the west side.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK as Ray and Quick drive off. We see Cantone’s car sitting halfway up the block. He has been watching the whole thing. He STARTS his ENGINE, turns on lights, and pulls out. He slowly drives off after Ray and Quick’s car. INT. RAY AND QUICK’S CAR - NIGHT 115A Ray and Quick are proceeding west.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Ray, I don’t like the cops taking Sunshine and the money.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I told you. Stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. We’re gonna do it my way. Now keep cool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 115A
dialogues.text: Revised a/o June 16, 1989 103D.* cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The police car turns into the alley and drives down to a midway. The sign above the door reads "BANK." SUGAR and Q look around, fumble with the door a little, open it, and

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE OF SAME ALLEY
dialogues.text: CANTONE’S car drives up and parks behind the police car. gets out, looks at the sign, takes out his gun and goes i cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: CANTONE cautiously walks into the room, looks around and the bank vault door...it is open. He walks up to the door steps into the room, gun extended. He finds QUICK and SUG standing and looking at hin.

dialogues.speaker: CANTONE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Maybe you guys can clear something up for me. I mean, I thought you might pull something, that’s why I followed Vento tonight. And I gotta tell ya, the whole thing was going pretty cute til some real boys showed up and spoiled it for you guys. You did the right thing just letting them go and not trying to start any shit. But the one thing I can’t figure out for the life of me is why the fuck you guys would break into a bank that’s been closed for five years. QUICK looks at RAY.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: (to Ray) May I?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Please do. QuIcK Well, first of all, we knew with Richie doing such a big pick-up Bugsy would have his number one hoy tailing him just to make sure notning (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised a/o June 16, 1989 103E.*

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: happened. And the cops that stopped us, you win some, you lose some. But as far as us breaking into the bank that’s been closed for five years, we’re not making a withdrawal, we’re making a deposit.

dialogues.speaker: CANTONE
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: It means put the gun down. cuT TO CANTONE’S FACE We hear the sound of guns being cocked behind him. He tur around, only to see SUGAR’S boys pointing the guns at him

dialogues.speaker: JIMMIE, WILLIE, JEROME
dialogues.text: (in unison) Surprise!!! (A la surprise party) cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: CANTONE is tied to a chair in the center.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: We'll call the police on Monday and let them know you’re in here.

dialogues.speaker: CANTONE
dialogues.text: Hey Sugar, these things don’t have that much air in them!

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t worry. Jimmy estimates that you can stay-in here a couple o’ days before you run out of oxygen. You’re estimate’s pretty accurate isn’t it Timmy?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Give or take a couple of hours. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised a/o June 16, 1989 1O3F.*

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (To Cantone as he and the boys are leaving) See, give or take a couple o’ hours.

dialogues.speaker: CANTONE
dialogues.text: (Just as Ray gets to the door) Hey Ray, I might see you again.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Could be....Goodnight. Vault door closes in CANTONE’S face.  Revised a/o March 29, 1989 104. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRON MAN KIRKPATRICK hitting the canvas. ‘ CALHOUNE — Knockout! A fuckin’ knockout!!! With the money I lost tonight I’m not gonna win shit. After I pay off these bets, I‘1l he even money. Shit, what the hell was that about? A man walks up to BUGSY and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: What?! cuT TO 117 INT - BUGSY’S PENTHOUSE - NIGHT 117 BUGSY is sitting around with some of his boys.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: I wanna know who ordered this hit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We spoke to the other families. Everyhody is claiming they know nothing about it. LEONI . What about the club owner, Sugar Ray, - and his guys?

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: What, are you fucking crazy?! He’s a fuckin’ dance hall runner. Somebody hit all of my places at the same time! And it weren’t no fuckin’ jig! And where the hell is Cantone when I need him?! A man pokes his head through the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Bugs, Richie’s here.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Let him in. The man leaves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 Revised a/o March 29, 1989 105. *

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: I wanna get to the bottom of this thing tonight. RICHIE VENTO comes in holding the bag.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s with all the sad faces?

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Just give me the money and get the fuck out. RICHIE walks over and hands him the bag. CALHOUNE looks i and slaps RICHIE.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Where’s my money? He pours the contents of the bag on the table.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (sees the packets) They took the wrong bag! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised a/o April 10, 1989 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What‘d they look like?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: It was two colored cops first, and then two of Cantone’s men showed up. They’re the ones who ; * have the bag.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It don’t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: I wanna know what’s going on. The same people that hit my spots probably hit Richie. Someone get Cantone on the phone right away. One of the guys picks up the phone and begins to dial.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it don’t figure. Why would they steal your money and leave this dope behind? Why wouldn’t they take the heroin?

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: You gave a million dollars of * my money to a couple of cops for a bag of heroin?! Slaps him again. CALHOUNE pokes his finger in the bag and tastes the powde

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: This isn’t heroin...it’s sugar. He looks at Tony.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Sugar?!

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: That son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: MAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: (to Calhoune) There’s no answer, he must not be in. The DOORBELL RINGS and CALHOUNE motions for one of the gu answer it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VERA comes Revised a/o March 28, 1989 107. * 117 ONE OF CALHOUNE’S BOYS It’s a woman named Vera. Says she works for Ray.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Let her in. into the room. She appears very upset.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Mr. Calhoune, I’m so sorry. I just want you to know I had nothing to do with any of this.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you have a seat?

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: (sitting down) I would have warned you, Mr. Calhoune, but Sugar would have killed me. His son shot me once you know.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand, Miss...

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Walker. Vera Walker.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: (to one of his boys) Hey, Mick, get Miss Walker something to drink.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: I just wanted you to know I had nothing to do with it. I ain’t no thief. I’m an honest ho and all my hos is honest and we didn’t want no parts of this thing from the beginning. But they made us keep quiet. I tell you, I would’ve warned you, but I know they would have killed me. I don’t want no trouble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised a/o May 3, 1989 108. 117

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: There’s not gonna be any trouble, Miss Walker. Nobody’s gonna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: No, nobody is gonna hurt you. In fact, you might be of some assis-~ tance to us.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Well, anything I can do to help I’1ll do, ‘cause I don’t want no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Well, all of this didn’t happen too long ago. Maybe you could help us locate Mr. Ray and Mr. Quick.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: They’re at Ray’s house. But please don’t tell them I told you. TI don’t want no more trouble. I just wanna go about my business. I don’t want to have nobody after me. I’m an old woman. I can’t take all this fighting and shooting and mess no more,

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Well, don’t worry, ma‘am, you did the right thing. We’ll see to it you have no more problems. In fact, Tony, write my number * down. If you ever have any * problem, you call me. You see, you do right by us--we do right by you.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: (getting up) Well, thank you, sir. (to Calhoune) And thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: Someone show Miss Walker out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised a/o March 28, 1989 109. * 117

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: (leaving) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: CALHOUNE
dialogues.text: (putting on his jacket) Why don’t we pay Mr. Ray and Mr. Quick a visit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know, I was just going to make the same suggestion.  Revised a/o March 28, 1989 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117A EXT. RAY’S BROWNSTONE - NIGHT 1172 Calhoune‘s limo pulls up in front of Ray’s brownstone. Af some henchmen get out and see that the coast is clear, Bu gets out of the car and they go up to the door, 117B INT. RAY’S BROWNSTONE - NIGHT 117E Bugsy’s men gain easy access to the brownstone. Once insi the place appears to be empty except that they hear a RAD coming from the living room on the second floor. 117C INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT 117¢ Bugsy and his men cautiously make their way to the living door. It is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Bugsy pushes the door open, the RADIO is ON and the room empty. They go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At*the far end of the room Cantone appears to be seated i chair listening to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey, boss, it’s Cantone.

dialogues.speaker: BUGSY
dialogues.text: (calling to him) Phil!

dialogues.speaker: CANTONE
dialogues.text: There is no response. Bugsy indicates that one of his men should go over and check it out. When they do, they see t is only Cantone’s hat and overcoat propped up in the easy

dialogues.speaker: BUGSY
dialogues.text: This is a setup. Cantone’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS. Tony is about to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: BUGSY
dialogues.text: (yelling) No! We rigged that phone, you jerkoff. The PHONE CONTINUES to RING. Leoni steps out into the hal check the rest of the house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 117E
dialogues.text: Revised a/o March 28, 1989 110A. *

dialogues.speaker: BUGSY
dialogues.text: Nobody touch anything. I gotta figure this out. I gotta figure out the right move, Bugsy walks over to the phone and inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: He sees a wire coming out of the phone and disappearing under the rug.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Bugsy follows the path of the wire until it reappears fro the rug and leads to the doorjamb.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Bugsy sees that the door is rigged, not the phone. At tha moment Leoni comes back into the room and closes the door

dialogues.speaker: BUGSY
dialogues.text: (terrified) No! Don’t close... Leoni closes the door before Bugsy can warn him. EXT. RAY’S BROWNSTONE - NIGHT 117E The BROWNSTONE BLOWS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 Al22 Revised a/o June 12, 1989 ll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is sitting around, worried.

dialogues.speaker: BENNIE
dialogues.text: You think something went wrong? It’s twelve o’clock. There is a knock at the door. Sunshine is standing there with the two white police officers. There is a strange moment and everyone exchanges looks.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (his serious face suddenly warming up) Sorry we’re late.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Got caught in traffic. One of the cops hands Sugar Ray the duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: We just dumped the cop car a half hour ago. It couldn’t have been smoother. Everyone applauds.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. Let’s split ‘ this stuff and pat ourselves on the back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: WILLIE, JEROME, and JIMMY are driving off. SUGAR is givin farewells. ANNIE is sitting in the back of SUGAR’S car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: li. *
Al22* + oe OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + oe ok ok  122 Revised a/o June 12, 1989 111A.

dialogues.text: j

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: (in his car) Hey Sugar, where you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: SUGAR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We ain’t made up our i minds yet. i WILLIE . Well, listen man, I’m going south. Let me give you a number...

dialogues.speaker: SUGAR
dialogues.text: No man, no numbers. I don’t wanna know where any of y’all are...case anybody needs to find you. Are you hip?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: (understanding) Yeah man, I’m hip. Hey man, y’all take care of yourselves. Off camera we hear VERA’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Sugar, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: SUGAR
dialogues.text: I’m comin’. He gives his friend a pound (slaps him five) and Willie d off. SUGAR walks over to his car. BENNIE and QUICK and the WHI are standing on the driver’s side. VERA is walking up fro hotel bickering. ANNIE is in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: SUGAR
dialogues.text: (to white cops, shaking their hands) Thanks a lot guys. Don’t spend it all in one place. WHITE COPS walk off.

dialogues.speaker: VERA
dialogues.text: Shit. Let’s get moving y’all, before somebody comes limping up here looking for us.  112

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: QUICK and BENNIE are looking at the New York skyline from they're standing. At this point, BENNIE, QUICK, SUGAR and are all standing by open car doors. : SUGAR (looking at the city) I'm sure gonna miss that place. Y'all know we can't never come back.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: New York ain't the only city in the world. We'll just start all over again.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but there ain't nothin' like Harlem.

dialogues.speaker: BENNIE
dialogues.text: You ain't lying, Sugar. (turning around) Let me look at it one more time. VERA (Getting in the car) Don't waste your time. Get your blind ass in the car. BENNIE (getting in the car) Bitch, I'll kick your ass. We hear BENNIE and VERA bickering QUICK (to Ray) So where you wanna go, Pop?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Well son, we got a tank full of gas...

dialogues.speaker: QUICK
dialogues.text: And a trunk full of money. That sounds like a sweet combination to me.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yep, sweet as sugar.... They exchange smiles, get in the car, and head down the h as we roll credits and go to the mother fuckin' bank.
